text: This is a list of rivers of Korea. == Main rivers of South Korea == Name hangul hanja length 1 Hantan River 한탄강 漢灘江 136 km (84.5 mi) 2 Imjin River 임진강 臨津江 273.50 km (170 mi) 3 Soyang River 소양강 昭陽江 156.8 km (97.43 mi) 4 Hongcheon River 홍천강 洪川江 143 km (88.9 mi) 5 Bukhan River 북한강 北漢江 482.8 km (300 mi) 6 Han River 한강 漢江 494 km (307 mi) 7 Namhan River 남한강 南漢江 8 Geum River 금강 錦江 397 km (247 mi) 9 Mangyeong River 만경강 萬頃江 77.4 km (44 mi) 10 Dongjin River 동진강 東津江 51 km (31.7 mi) 11 Yeongsan River 영산강 榮山江 129.50 km (80.5 mi) 12 Seomjin River 섬진강 蟾津江 212.3 km (131.7 mi) 13 Nakdong River 낙동강 洛東江 510 km (317 mi) 14 Geumho River 금호강 琴湖江 116 km (72 mi) 15 Hwang River 황강 黃岡 111 km (~69 mi) 16 Nam River 남강 南江 == Main rivers of North Korea == Name hangul hanja length 1 Bukhan River 2 Chaeryong River 3 Changja River 4 Chongchon River 5 Han River 6 Hantan River 7 Imjin River 8 Nam River 9 Pothong River 10 Ryesong River 11 Taedong River / Daedong River 대동강 大同江 439 km (27 mi) 12 Taeryong River 대령강 大寧江 13 Tumen River 두만강 图们江 521 km (324 mi) 14 Yalu River 압록강 鸭绿江 790 km (490 mi) ==Korean rivers flowing into the Yellow Sea (West Sea)== *Yalu River, known in Korean as the "Amnok River" (압록강)
